meanings.definition: Of poor quality or value; rubbish.
meanings.sent1: The movie we watched last night was so dreckish that we couldn't even finish it.
meanings.sent2: The old toy looked dreckish with its faded colors and missing parts.
meanings.sent3: I tried to fix the dreckish painting by adding glitter, but it just made it worse.
meanings.sent4: Her dreckish attempt at baking a cake resulted in a burnt, inedible mess.
meanings.sent5: The dreckish smell coming from the dumpster made everyone hold their noses.

meanings.sent1: The artist's new sculpture had a dreckish appearance that divided opinions among viewers.
meanings.sent2: The abandoned house had a dreckish feel to it, with broken windows and overgrown weeds.
meanings.sent3: Despite its dreckish design, the quirky chair became a favorite among collectors.
meanings.sent4: The dreckish clouds in the sky hinted at an impending storm.
meanings.sent5: The dreckish taste of the soup made everyone grimace in disgust.
